summary:

title: Live coverage: New Falcon 9 booster to make second attempt at debut on Starlink delivery mission
summary: SpaceX will try again Tuesday to launch a brand new Falcon 9 booster after an abort halted its first attempt. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral, with 23 Starlink satellites aboard, is scheduled for 11:19 p.m. EDT (0319 UTC).

summary: President Trump appointed U.S. Space Force’s Gen. Michael Guetlein today to lead the Golden Dome missile defense shield project.  In a televised Oval Office meeting, Trump projected Golden Dome will […]

title: Sols 4543-4545: Leaving the Ridge for the Ridges

title: ESA Awards Contract for Probe That Will Land on Earth-Skimming Asteroid
summary:
ESA has awarded a contract for the second CubeSat for its Ramses mission, which will study asteroid Apophis as it passes within 32,000 kilometres of Earth. The Rapid Apophis Mission for Space Safety (Ramses) mission was first announced in July 2024 and is being managed under ESA’s Space Safety Programme. The mission will consist of […]
The post ESA Awards Contract for Probe That Will Land on Earth-Skimming Asteroid appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: MDA Space raises SatixFy offer by 43% to counter competing bid
summary:
Canada’s MDA Space has increased its offer for SatixFy by 43% following a competing bid for the Israeli satellite chipmaker, bringing the total value of the deal to around US$280 million.
The post MDA Space raises SatixFy offer by 43% to counter competing bid appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: China launches classified comms satellite, conducts commercial sea launch
summary:
China has continued an uptick in launch activity with a Long March 7A mission to geosynchronous orbit and sea launch of a Ceres-1 solid rocket.

title: Sunset on Mars
summary: NASA’s Mars Exploration Rover Spirit captured this stunning view as the Sun sank below the rim of Gusev crater on Mars 20 years ago. title: NASA Sets Coverage for 32nd SpaceX Resupply Mission Departure
summary: NASA and its international partners will soon receive scientific research samples and hardware after a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft departs the International Space Station on Thursday, May 22, for its return to Earth.
